page.title: 09WORSHIP:GOULCEBY-SCAMBLESBY
page.content: {All Saints}church,Goulceby,dating from the 11th cent.was for a time during the 12th/13th centuries,a chapel of the Knights Templar.The present church rebuilt on a new site in 1888,wasnot reconsecrated until 1908.{St.Peter's, Asterby,founded in the 12th cent.twice rebuilt,was closed in 1983 because of fabric decay.A{Baptist chapel,}erected in the 17th cent.survived until 1922. {Methodist & Wesleyan chapels},built in 1854 and 1866,were places of worship for about 100 yrs.The little church at Stenigot of{St.Nicholas}built for the De Guevara family in the 16th cent. was re-sited,and is now seldom used. Scamblesby's{St.Martin's,}was rebuilt in 1890 and is still in use.Scamblesby {Methodist chapel}was rebuilt on a new site to the North of the Mill Lane junction in 1978.The chapel is used regularly,by people from a wide area.
